people_also_ask.question: Do I need to soak buckwheat before cooking?
people_also_ask.heading: And please note pre-soaking DRASTICALLY cuts down on the amount of time buckwheat cooks. If you don't want to pre-soak, then simply give it a quick rinse before cooking. Alternatively, you can toast it in a dry pan to bring out more flavor. By the way, when you toast buckwheat it then is known as kasha.
